Articles.Content: Preferably fueled, is there a mod that does this?

For rockets or space planes?

Check out [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92278"]Radial Engine Mounts[/URL]

[quote name='hab136']For rockets or space planes?

Check out [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92278"]Radial Engine Mounts[/URL][/QUOTE]

I mean something more like:

[IMG]http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/7/70/LFB_KR-1x2.png[/IMG]

That curved bulge that houses the engine, except instead of an engine the bulge would be filled with fuel and instead of the nozzle there would be an attachment point.

Making radial engine housings would not take long. Simple shapes, easy to texture. It is actually not a bad idea, as it would open up for a lot of new stage designs. Also not having to use those ugly aerodynamic-looking stock parts when making Saturn V or Atlas V first stage. I've modeled a whole bunch of custom parts for myself, so I might just go ahead and make these for myself as well. Thanks for the idea :)

[URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93067"]Modular Rocket Systems[/URL] has these (the bottom left is what I think you want):

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/nnpiCnX.jpg[/IMG]

[quote name='hab136'][URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93067"]Modular Rocket Systems[/URL] has these (the bottom left is what I think you want):

[URL]http://i.imgur.com/nnpiCnX.jpg[/URL][/QUOTE]

Yeah I love those parts but I mean standalone ones.
